channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.description:

DescribePack: Loose caps and coverings were discovered upon inspection. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was taken to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023120410
item.description:
Report X-2023120410

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet and was moved into a drum. The sealed drum was moved to the hazmat cage by a manager for an admin to process it. DescribePack: The box corners were pushed in, the bottom side of the box is crushed. The bottle's cap was a bit loose but it only leaks when apply pressure to the container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a sealed drum to contain any leak.

item.title: Report X-2023120381
item.description:
Report X-2023120381

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING SLIGHTLY. IT WAS BROUGHT TO QA FOR INSPECTION DUE TO FLAMMABLE LIQUID STICKER. DescribePack: 1 OF THE 4 GALLON CONTAINERS HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING A LEAKAGE. ABOUT 1/4 OF THE BOTTLE HAD LEAKED OUT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ITEM WAS PLACED IN A YELLOW DRUM AND SECURED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE

item.title: Report X-2023120332
item.description:
Report X-2023120332

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-02
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package was found on trailer # 558833 already wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 4 x 1 plastic bottles of Nu-Brite coil condenser cleaner 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle of Nu- Brite coil condenser cleaner had a loose cap allowed .25 gallon to release from bottle package had slotted partition and corrugated liner. facility procedures for damaged hazardous material followed contents contained and awaiting deposition. DescribePack: 1 X 1 gallon plastic bottle of Nu-Brite coil condenser cleaner had a loose cap allowed .25 gallon to release from bottle DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package unloaded from trailer leaking. Happened during the preload sort. placed inside a hazardaous material bag. DescribePack: Plastic was pinched at the bottom which leaked liquid out. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package placed inside a hazardous material bag to prevent any liquid from leaking more onto the floor and other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023120454
item.description:
Report X-2023120454

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was pushed from the unload belt to the j loop, where it tipped on its side. One of the caps was loose allowing some of the contents to escape. DescribePack: Loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the leak was discovered, the package was righted, and what had escaped very quickly evaporated.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 2 x 2.5 gallon plastic bottles of convo clean forte one 2.5 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap leaking and allowing .25 gallons to release no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 2.5 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023120294
item.description:
Report X-2023120294

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: MUNCY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Van was being unloaded by the evening crew, package handler noticed that the box was wet and let manager know. Manager placed box safely in hazmat bin and brought to QA to be processed. DescribePack: The leakage was due to a loose lid. Unsure if it left the shipper that way or if it started to come undone by being bounced around on a van. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Manager brought package to QA and emailed the station about the incident.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package found on trailer # 841173 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 5 liter plastic bottles of medivators rapicide Pa part A and part B one 5 liter plastic bottle of rapicidePa part A had a loose cap allowing .25 liters to release. package did have slotted partition and a inner box but no bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 5 liter plastic bottle of rapicidePa part A had a loose cap allowing .25 liters to release into DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report E-2023120121
item.description:
Report E-2023120121

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to unknown reasons approximately .25 lb of Dynadet/Gardoclean T 5417 (Hazardous - UN1823) was released. The released product was contained to the dock floor. The SDS with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, and damaged container were placed into a 65 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2023120120
item.description:
Report E-2023120120

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spil was discovered on the dock in Greencastle, PA. The spill consisted of (1) 50 pound plastic bag of Provox C (UN3378), which was found torn along the side, spilling approximately 3 ounces onto the dock floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they swept up the contents and placed them into a 10 gallon poly drum for disposal and left it onsite for pickup.
